isis.stitle: TSI 08-16-02 - Improved Calibration Procedure for Optional Instrument Cluster Compass

subjectgroup.subject: Improved Calibration Procedure for Optional Instrument Cluster Compass

geninfo.para: This calibration procedure for the optional instrument cluster compass has been improved and replaces the old procedure printed in Operator's Manuals published prior to January 2008. The following procedure should be followed for compass calibration.

svcproc.title: Improved Instrument Cluster Compass Calibration Procedure

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, pull vehicle off roadway and away from all other traffic before performing the following procedure.

svcprocinfo.para: All new vehicles with an optional compass must have an initial compass calibration performed. A compass calibration may or may not have been completed at the vehicle assembly plant. If the compass headings are noticeably incorrect, or become noticeably incorrect, or the NO CAL message is displayed, the Declination Zone may need to be reset to agree with the current geographic location, or the Compass Directional Calibration will need to be recalibrated.

The compass direction is displayed in the lower left quadrant of the Instrument Cluster Display just below the outdoor temperature reading. Text messages necessary to calibrate the compass can be found in the Instrument Cluster Display in the lower right quadrant (quadrant 2) of the display. Twist the Instrument Cluster Display Knob until the curser is flashing in the lower right quadrant. Press the Instrument Cluster Display Knob until the desired text message is displayed. Compass Calibration related text messages include "Calibrate Compass", "Compass Declination", "Declination Zone #", and "End Calibration".

note.para: The Declination Zone for the location where the Compass Calibration procedure is being performed must be set first, and thereafter the Compass Directional Calibration procedure can be performed. Both procedures are listed on the following pages and must be followed exactly to ensure proper calibration of the compass.

svcsubproc.title: Compass Declination Zone Set Procedure
svcsubproc.para: The Declination Zone number is used to account for the errors between magnetic North and true North in the vehicle's geographic operating area, and must be set correctly for the compass to display accurate headings.

note.para: When calibrating/recalibrating the compass, you must select the Declination Zone which corresponds to the location where the compass calibration is being performed. It can be reset later to match the Declination zone where the vehicle will be operating.

svcsubproc.para: For vehicles that regularly operate coast-to-coast or in several different Declination Zones, either choose a Declination Zone in the geographic center of the vehicle's operating area, or change the Declination Zone daily to match the present Declination Zone.
To begin the Declination Zone set procedure, the vehicle must be stopped with ignition key ON. Refer to Zone Map for determining the proper Declination Zone number.

entry.para: Select Quadrant 2 (lower right) on the display by turning the display control knob either clockwise or counter-clockwise.
Select the Compass Declination message by pressing and releasing the display control knob until this message appears.
Press and hold the display control knob until any Declination Zone number (0 - 10) is displayed.

Turn the display control knob clockwise or counter-clockwise until the desired Declination Zone number is displayed. Refer to Zone Map 1 to determine the proper number for the current geographic location.

note.para: If no Declination Zone number is selected within 15 seconds, the display will return to the Compass Declination message.

If the compass is being calibrated/recalibrated the Declination Zone must be set to the Zone number for the location where the compass calibration/recalibration is being performed regardless of the location where the vehicle will eventually operate.

entry.para: Press and HOLD the display control knob until the Compass Declination message appears (this indicates that the new Declination Zone number has been programmed into the compass).

svcsubproc.title: Compass Directional Calibration Procedure
svcsubproc.para: To begin the Compass Directional Calibration Procedure, stop the vehicle in an area large enough to permit driving in complete circles and perform the following steps:

entry.para: Select Quadrant 2 (lower right) on the instrument cluster display by turning the display control knob either clockwise or counter-clockwise.
Select the Calibrate Compass message by pressing and releasing the display control knob until this message appears.
Press and hold the display control knob (3 to 5 seconds) until the End Calibration command is displayed.

note.para: IF the End Calibration command will not show up, turn OFF the vehicle, restart it, and return to Step 1.

The following steps (4 through 6) must be completed within 3 minutes to lock-in the new calibration. Do not press the display control knob or turn the key OFF until these steps are completed or the calibration process will be cancelled.

entry.para: Immediately following the End Calibration command being displayed, drive the vehicle in 3 complete circles (during this time the compass display will go blank or have dashed lines present).
Stop the vehicle and wait shortly. The End Calibration message should reappear on the display.

Push and HOLD the display control knob until the End Calibration command disappears. The calibration should now be complete. IMPORTANT! Just pressing and failing to hold the display control knob inward until the End Calibration command disappears will cancel the calibration procedure and you must start over at Step 1.

Test the compass calibration. Turn the vehicle ignition key OFF and then restart the vehicle. Wait 10 seconds to for the compass to complete its self test. Drive the vehicle in a circle and note the compass readings. If the lower left quadrant of the Instrument Panel Display shows the correct compass/vehicle heading, the compass calibration is now complete. If the compass readings are incorrect, inspect for correct Declination Zone number, turn OFF the vehicle, restart the vehicle, wait 10 seconds, and perform another circle while periodically noting the compass readings. If readings are still incorrect restart the compass calibration procedure.
